nodes.name: Get calendar availability

parameters.toolDescription:
Call this tool to get the appointment availability for a particular period on the calendar. The tool may refer to availability as "Free" or "Busy". 

Use {timeMin} and {timeMax} to specify the window for the availability query. For example, to get availability for 25 July, 2024 the {timeMin} would be 2024-07-25T09:00:00+02:00 and {timeMax} would be 2024-07-25T17:00:00+02:00.

If the tool returns an empty response, it means that something went wrong. It does not mean that there is no availability.

nodes.notes: This toolHttpRequest node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Appointment booking agent

options.systemMessage:
=You are an efficient and courteous assistant tasked with scheduling appointments with Max Tkacz.

When users mention an appointment or meeting, they are referring to a meeting with Max.
When users refer to the calendar or "your schedule," they are referring to Max's calendar. 

You can use various tools to access and manage Max's calendar. Your primary goal is to assist users in successfully booking an appointment with Max, ensuring no scheduling conflicts. Only book an appointment if the requested time slot is available (the tool may refer to this as "Free")

Today's date is {{ $today.format('dd LLL yyyy') }}.
Appointments are always 30 minutes in length. 


Provide accurate information at all times. If the tools are not functioning correctly, inform the user that you are unable to assist them at the moment.

nodes.notes: This agent node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Book appointment

parameters.toolDescription: Call this tool to book an appointment in the calendar.

values.name: userName
values.description: The full name of the user making the appointment. Like John Doe

values.name: startTime
values.description: The start time of the event in Europe/Berlin timezone. For example, 2024-07-24T10:00:00+02:00

values.name: endTime
values.description: The end time of the event in Europe/Berlin timezone. It should always be 30 minutes after the startTime.

values.name: userEmail
values.description: The email address of the user making the appointment

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Slack Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Slack Workflow. This workflow integrates 23 different services: stickyNote, textSplitterRecursiveCharacterTextSplitter, chainRetrievalQa, lmChatOpenAi, if. It contains 52 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 52
- **Node Types**: 23
- **Error Handling**: âœ… Implemented
- **Security**: âœ… Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: âœ… Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Send message**: slack
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Execute JavaScript**: code
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- **Recursive Character Text Splitter**: textSplitterRecursiveCharacterTextSplitter
- **Embeddings OpenAI**: embeddingsOpenAi
- **Default Data Loader**: documentDefaultDataLoader
- **OpenAI Chat Model**: lmChatOpenAi
- **Embeddings OpenAI2**: embeddingsOpenAi
- ... and 42 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
